t: Psalm 83
O God, Do Not Keep Silence
A Song. A Psalm of Asaph.
O*pn God, do not keep silence; do*ld not hold your peace or be still, O God!
For*ln behold, your enemies make an uproar; those*ld who hate you have raised their heads.
They*ln lay crafty plans against your people; they*ld consult together against your treasured ones.
They*ln say, “Come, let us wipe them out as a nation; let*ld the name of Israel be remembered no more!”
For*ln they conspire with one accord; against*ld you they make a covenant—
the*ln tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab*ld and the Hagrites,
Gebal*ln and Ammon and Amalek, Philistia*ld with the inhabitants of Tyre;
Asshur*ln also has joined them; they*ld are the strong arm of the children of Lot. Selah*ig
Do*pn to them as you did to Midian, as*ld to Sisera and Jabin at the river Kishon,
who*ln were destroyed at En-dor, who*ld became dung for the ground.
Make*ln their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, all*ld their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
who*ln said, “Let us take possession for ourselves of*ld the pastures of God.”
O*pn my God, make them like whirling dust, like*ld chaff before the wind.
As*ln fire consumes the forest, as*ld the flame sets the mountains ablaze,
so*ln may you pursue them with your tempest and*ld terrify them with your hurricane!
Fill*ln their faces with shame, that*ld they may seek your name, O Lord.*s
Let*ln them be put to shame and dismayed forever; let*ld them perish in disgrace,
that*ln they may know that you alone, whose*ld name is the Lord,*s are*ld the Most High over all the earth.
